_MHD_EXTERN struct MHD_Response *
MHD_create_response_empty (enum MHD_ResponseFlags flags)
{
  struct MHD_Response *r;
  r = (struct MHD_Response *) MHD_calloc_ (1, sizeof (struct MHD_Response));
  if (NULL != r)
  {
    if (MHD_mutex_init_ (&r->mutex))

      r->fd = -1;
      r->reference_count = 1;

      return r; /* Successful result */

}

explanation: MISRA Rule 17.2 concerns self-calls (direct or indirect recursion). Only function calls can introduce recursion. The fragments above include all function calls (and a comment suggesting an alternative function call) present in this function and therefore should be investigated for possible indirect calls back into MHD_create_response_empty. Other code in the function — variable declarations, assignments (r->fd = -1; r->reference_count = 1; r->flags = flags;), the return statements, and the linkage/storage macro in the function signature — do not perform function calls and thus cannot by themselves cause direct or indirect recursion and do not need further investigation for Rule 17.2.
